abstract: New York State racing authorities revoke the license of horse trainer Richard Dutrow Jr, who trained the 2008 Kentucky Derby winner Big Brown, for repeatedly violating and disregarding rules, barring him from state racetracks for at least 10 years and potentially ending his career; the action amounts to one of the most severe penalties issued in American racing and comes at a time when industry officials are trying to restore confidence in the sport.
snippet: The New York State Racing and Wagering Board revoked the license of the trainer Richard Dutrow Jr. and barred him from New York racetracks for at least 10 years.
lead_paragraph: The New York State Racing and Wagering Board revoked the license of the trainer Richard Dutrow Jr. and barred him from New York racetracks for at least 10 years.

headline.main: 3 Years After Triple Crown Bid, Trainer Is Given a 10-Year Ban
headline.print_headline: 3 Years After Triple Crown Bid, Trainer Is Given a 10-Year Ban
headline.seo: Dutrow Barred From Training Horses in New York for 10 Years
